Allen (architect)}} {{Other people5|William Allen|Henry Allen}} {{cleanup|date=May 2010}} {{Infobox military person |name=William Henry Allen |birth_date={{Birth date|1784|10|21}} |death_date={{death date and age|1813|8|18|1784|10|21}} |image=William Henry Allen (cropped).png |image_size=200 |caption= Lieutenant William Henry Allen, USN |birth_place= [[Providence, Rhode Island]] |death_place= [[Plymouth]], England |allegiance= [[United States|United States of America]] |branch= [[United States Navy]] |serviceyears= 1800–1813 |rank= [[Lieutenant]] |unit= |commands={{USS|Argus|1803}} |battles= |awards= |relations= |laterwork= }} '''William Henry Allen''' (21 October 1784 – 18 August 1813) was an [[United States|American]] naval officer during the [[War of 1812]]. ==Early life== Allen was born in [[Providence, Rhode Island]] and was appointed a [[midshipman]] in the [[United States Navy]] on 28 April 1800. Between 1800 and 1807, he served successively in [[USS George Washington (1798)|''George Washington'']] and [[USS Philadelphia (1799)|''Philadelphia'']]. In 1807, he transferred to [[USS Chesapeake (1799)|''Chesapeake'']] and, on 21 June, participated in the [[Chesapeake-Leopard Affair]]. Allen was credited with firing the only gun discharged in her own defense by the American ship. {{quotation | :His father, William Allen, on the breaking out of the American Revolution, was appointed a first lieutenant in the army. He continued in the army until the restoration of peace, and commanded the Rhode Island line of troops at the battle of [[Saratoga Springs, New York|Saratoga]], when he was advanced to the rank of major. William Allen was present and actively engaged in most of the battles which were fought during our revolutionary war; and in 1786, was appointed by [[United States Congress|Congress]], senior officer of the legionary corps raised in [[Rhode Island]]. In the year 1799, he was appointed by the legislature of that State, [[brigadier general]] of militia. The mother of William Henry Allen, was the sister of the (October 1843) Governor of Rhode Island.<ref>Frost, John, LL.D., "The Pictorial Book Of The Commodores; Comprising Lives Of Distinguished Commanders In The Navy Of The United States." Nafis & Cornish, New York, 1845. p. 247</ref>}} ==War of 1812== By 1812, he was first lieutenant in [[USS United States (1797)|''United States'']] and took part in the engagement with [[HMS Macedonian|HMS ''Macedonian'']]. At the conclusion of that capture, he was named to command the prize crew which took ''Macedonian'' into [[New York, New York|New York]]. In 1813, he took command of the brig [[USS Argus (1803)|''Argus'']]. On 14 August, he led his ship in the [[Capture of USS Argus|engagement with HMS ''Pelican'']] during which he received mortal wounds. A round shot cut off his right leg, but he remained at his station until he fainted from blood loss. After ''Argus''' surrender, Allen was taken to the hospital at [[Plymouth]]'s Millbay Prison where he died on 18 August 1813. Allen was buried with full military honors in the churchyard of St Andrew's, [[Plymouth]], England.<ref>'''Roosevelt, Theodore: ''The Naval War of 1812'''''; G. P. Putnam's Sons [1882] Naval Institute Press [1987]:<br/>ISBN 0-87021-445-4: pp. 125–126; 198-200; 203; 399.</ref> ==Namesakes== *Various ships [[USS Allen|USS ''Allen'']] * [[Allen Street (Manhattan)|Allen Street]] in [[Manhattan]], [[New York City]]<ref>'''Moscow, Henry: ''The Street Book'''''; Fordham University Press 1978: ISBN 0-8232-1275-0 p. 22.</ref> ==See also== {{Portal|United States Navy}} ==References== :{{DANFS}} :{{NHC}} {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.history.navy.mil/photos/pers-us/uspers-a/wh-allen.htm NHC Biography] *[http://www.history.navy.mil/danfs/a11/argus-i.htm NHC: Brig ''Argus''] {{Persondata | NAME =Allen, William Henry | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =American naval officer | DATE OF BIRTH =21 October 1784 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Providence, Rhode Island]] | DATE OF DEATH =18 August 1813 | PLACE OF DEATH =[[Plymouth]], England }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Allen, William Henry}} [[Category:American people of the War of 1812]] [[Category:United States Navy officers]] [[Category:People from Providence, Rhode Island]] [[Category:1784 births]] [[Category:1813 deaths]] [[Category:People from Rhode Island in the War of 1812]]
